title: Adjust global background image position (2in down, 3in left)

requirements.text: Update the global CSS background positioning so the current background image is shifted 2 inches downward and 3 inches to the left on both mobile and desktop breakpoints. Implement this by adjusting the `background-position` values in `frontend/src/index.css` for the `body` rule (mobile default) and the `@media (min-width: 768px) { body { ... } }` rule (desktop), while keeping `background-size: cover` and all existing background asset references unchanged.

quotes: adjust it's positioning by scaling it2 inches down and 3 inches to the left.

acceptanceCriteria: On viewports <768px, the computed `body` background position results in the background appearing shifted ~2in down and ~3in left relative to the prior `center top` position.
On viewports >=768px, the computed `body` background position results in the background appearing shifted ~2in down and ~3in left relative to the prior `center center` position.

No changes are made to background filenames/paths (e.g., `mawalking-user-bg-mobile.dim_1080x1920.*` and `mawalking-user-bg.dim_1920x1080.*` remain referenced), and the background still renders and covers the viewport.

constraints: Do not change any background asset filenames or paths referenced in `frontend/src/index.css`.
Do not modify any files under `frontend/src/components/ui` or the immutable hook/entry files listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
nonGoals: Generating or editing any background image files.
Changing service worker caching or precache lists for background assets.
